CatDescriptText: Noraella Brown, gas company employee, Homewood and Dave VanDeveer, photographer, Library, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think there will be a Third World War?  If so, what do you think will be the cause or causes?" Noraella Brown's answer reads: "Looking on the situation as such, there is a lot of unrest.  But I have an optimistic viewpoint.  But there are a lot of factors when people are gaining freedom, like in Africa, which may influence the big powers into World War III.  However, I hope this won't happen."  Dave VanDeveer's answer reads: "I really don't think there will be a third World War, but there will continue to be an ideological war.  Let's hope, at least, that there won't be a World War III."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Noraella Brown wearing hat with feathers and netting and coat with brooch on right collar, holding handbag under right arm, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Dave VanDeveer wearing eyeglasses, dark necktie, and coat, standing under Jenkins Arcade marquee, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
